The ratio of volunteer potato emergence defined as
changed 0.24 times (=exp (−14.4 × 0.1)) by every 0.10 m increase in the D max ( Fig. 2a). Indeed, the emergence ratios of volunteer potatoes at the D max of 0.20, 0.25, 0.30, and 0.35 m were 0.04, 0.02, 0.01, and <0.01, respectively. These results indicated that the current soil frost depth used (0.3–0.4 m) declines the emergence ratio to an unrecognisable level (<0.01).
